ratings.comment: Kim is the absolute best. He is by far my favorite professor in the Anthro program. His lectures are always engaging and he makes it very clear what information should be remembered for exams.
Anthro 102 has 5-6 lecturers that teach at different points in the semester. Kim was easily the best one and easiest to learn because of how accessible he teaches the lectures.

Prof. Kim is awesome! He is super passionate about the subject, which makes his lectures very interesting. His slides are very helpful as he makes all key terms and things he expects us to know. I love how Prof. Kim connects anthropology to current events, making archaeology much closer to life. Very approachable. Great lecturer.

I took 322 with Professor Kim in Spring 2024. I loved his class and would HIGHLY recommend to anyone considering it to take any class he teaches. Truly passionate about the subject and extremely nice and approachable! Online tests and a group project. Hosts quiz bowl review sessions before tests and makes them super fun!

Professor Kim was an awesome instructor. Although class wasn't mandatory, you never wanted to miss it because he made the course content interesting. I would 100% take another class taught by Professor Kim. You're graded on three exams, one team project, and a final paper. Grading is fair and test questions aren't designed to "get you."

Prof. Kim's lectures are awesome. The stuff he chooses to showcase is extremely interesting, and he is a very engaging lecturer. His slideshows are very clear and it's very easy to study for his class, but rather than just basic memorization, you'll actually understand how all of his points link together and be able to explain them well.

Focus on the green font on his slides, its literally the whole exam. Exam is online and I scored an A. Kim CARES about you. Definitely better than Pickering and Bowie for other sections of this course. Kim is a gem.

102 had 4 different professors teaching and Professor Kim was by far my favorite. This could be because of the topic he teaches but I also enjoy his lecturing style overall but I would recommend going to lecture.

Mr. Kim is straightforward, has green font on his lecture slides that indicates it will be on the exam. I studied just the green font and got a 100/100 on my exam. Woah...did not expect that. HE IS GREAT, and he CARES. He's with us and wants us to do well! HIGHLY recommend

Really cool guy and awesome to hear him talk about Vietnam, I did not know all of the drama going on with China around claiming Coa Loa he is super knowledgeable and I would highly recommend professor Kim.

I loved Origins of Civilization with Dr. Kim. His lectures are incredible and the assignments and tests are open note and easy, which takes all the pressure off of learning the material. I went to almost every lecture purely because I liked them so much. 10/10 I loved him

Professor Kim is a great teacher. His lectures are interesting and he highlights the material that is the most important in green font. He also publishes the slides online after class. The readings are not necessary and the test was very fair. Overall I enjoyed his section a lot.

Professor Kim is one of 5ish prof's who teach this course as they all have their own specialties, but his section was awesome and he did a section in Anthro100 I took too and enjoyed. He makes what is needed to know obvious by highlighting it and is accessible outside of class.
Straightforward lectures, exams are incredibly fair, and he is generous with grading. Clap for credits.
Professor Kim's lectures were my favorite in the course. He was passionate about the topics we were learning and it made the lectures more interesting and I was excited when a new lecture was posted.

He was 1 of 5 lecturers and was easily a favorite of mine. He was very knowledgeable and thoroughly explained his topics, keeping me engaged. He highlighted important pieces of his lectures so that you knew to make note of them. I didn't read any of the readings, but I took notes on every slide and did very well on his exam.
Great professor and fascinating lectures!

Prof. Kim is a great lecturer. All of the slides are well thought out and are applicable to the test. Tests are easy if you go to class, do the readings, and participate in his quiz bowls. There was little work outside of class.

Professor Kim is one of the best professors I've had at UW! His lectures are always interesting and thought provoking and this class is one of my favorite. The attendance and grading in the class is also pretty lax, as long as you put in effort.
good
Dr. Kim was 1 of 5 lecturers for this course and was my favorite. Super skilled lecturer, reasonable readings, and a blast to talk to outside of class. Would recommend him to anyone.

Great professor, easy to understand, no accent, very knowledgeable, test is mostly lecture slides, but going to class really makes everything fit together. Some questions on exams deal with things exclusively said in class. I'd take a class with him again if I could, very glad I took this class. Group projects and activities, do your work  A

Anthro 102 is taught by 5 professors who all have different styles. Nam Kim was definitely the best - Mark Kenoyer was the worst. The class is unnecessarily hard for a Humanities elective. I wish I would have taken a different class. The material is somewhat interesting but tests and grading are too hard.

Was 1/5 professors for Anthro 102. Very clear presentations - highlights the most important words. Perfect speed for lectures - not too fast or slow. Interesting content. Am taking another class with him next semester, so clearly a good guy. Very short readings - 2-5 pages a night!
He's one of my few professors that actually highlights important information on the lectures, and his talks are interesting and informative.
Best professor in this class. Is really clear about what lecture material he is testing on. Assigns shorter and more interesting readings than the other professors.

Professor Kim was the best possible teacher for this course. If you are an anthropology major, you have to take this course and you should definitely take it with Professor Kim if he offers it again. He cares a lot about the subject and the students, he harbors great discussion and responses for a class of 15 kids. Take every course with Nam Kim.

took this class with very little interest or knowledge of anthro, professor Kim made the class interesting. he is by far the most genuine and caring professor i have had. grades easy, but can't cut you slack on his multiple choice exams- study lecture slides!!
A super understanding and kind professor, look over power points for tests and beware of the readings for quizzes
Nam Kim is kind, funny, extremely knowledgeable, and a great person overall. Would highly recommend his class to anyone with an interest in archaeology, ancient warfare, and anthropology in general.
Very interesting material and a good lecturer. Was clear about exam details. I would take his class again in a heartbeat.
Material is somewhat interesting. Exam is easy. He is very clear what you need to study for the exam.
Dr. Kim is an excellent professor. He is funny and genuinely cares about teaching students. Best of all, he makes it VERY clear what to study. Focus on the highlighted text and you'll be solid.

Of all three professors for anthro 100 (Pickering for Biology, Kim for Archaeology, and Patrick for Culture) Kim was definitely my favorite. He made what would be on his midterm so much more understandable than the other two. I really enjoyed taking his portion of this class. The other two, not as much.
Not a bad professor as far as trying to keep lectures interesting. Thought he was a little too ambitious in trying to get people to participate, makes for a lot of awkward silences.
